org.scilab.modules.scinotes
Class MatchingBlockManager

java.lang.Object
  org.scilab.modules.scinotes.MatchingBlockManager

public class MatchingBlockManager
extends java.lang.Object

Useful to match opening and closing keywords from left to right or from right to left

MatchingBlockManager

public MatchingBlockManager(ScilabDocument doc,
                            ScilabEditorPane pane,
                            boolean lr,
                            javax.swing.text.Highlighter highlighter)
Constructor

Parameters:
doc - the doc to highlight
pane - the ScilabEditorPane associated with this Manager
lr - if true the matching is from left to right
highlighter - the highlighter to use
Method Detail

getScanner

public MatchingBlockScanner getScanner()
Returns:
the scanner used by thhis manager

setPainterForOpenClose

public void setPainterForOpenClose(boolean filled,
                                   boolean included,
                                   java.awt.Color color)
Set the painter for the matching open/close keywords (such as '('/')' or '['/']'). The contents between the matchings is highlighted.

Parameters:
filled - true if a filled rectangle must be used to highlight
color - the color of the painter

setPainterForOpenClose

public void setPainterForOpenClose(int type,
                                   java.awt.Color color)
Set the painter for the matching open/close keywords (such as '('/')' or '['/']'). The matchings are highlighted.

Parameters:
type - one of the three values : ScilabKeywordsPainter.FILLED ScilabKeywordsPainter.UNDERLINED ScilabKeywordsPainter.FRAMED
color - the color of the painter

setPainterForOpenClose

public void setPainterForOpenClose()
Set the painter for the matching open/close keywords (such as '('/')' or '['/']'). Properties are found in the file scinotesConfiguration.xml The contents between the matchings is highlighted.

setPainterForKeywords

public void setPainterForKeywords(boolean filled,
                                  boolean strict,
                                  boolean included,
                                  java.awt.Color color)
Set the painter for the matching keywords (such as 'function' and 'endfunction'). The contents between the matchings is highlighted.

Parameters:
filled - true if a filled rectangle must be used to highlight
color - the color of the painter

setPainterForKeywords

public void setPainterForKeywords(int type,
                                  java.awt.Color color)
Set the painter for the matching keywords (such as 'function' and 'endfunction'). The matchings are highlighted.

Parameters:
type - one of the three values : ScilabKeywordsPainter.FILLED ScilabKeywordsPainter.UNDERLINED ScilabKeywordsPainter.FRAMED
color - the color of the painter

setPainterForKeywords

public void setPainterForKeywords()
Set the painter for the matching keywords. Properties are found in the file scinotesConfiguration.xml The contents between the matchings is highlighted.

                                int tok,
